Package edu.sdccd.cisc191.b.client

Class EnemyShip

java.lang.Object
edu.sdccd.cisc191.b.client.Ship
edu.sdccd.cisc191.b.client.EnemyShip
public class EnemyShip
extends Ship
The enemy ship class extended the Ship class. It defines additional features such as enemy's type, a hit box, the score drop value, and its collision status (also known as its survival status).
Author:
Joaquin Dicang, Sholehani Hafezi, Kim Lim

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    EnemyShip​(int x, int y, int type)
    Initializes the enemy's ships x and y coordinates and its type according to passed argument values.

  • Constructor Details

    • EnemyShip

      public EnemyShip​(int x, int y, int type)
      Initializes the enemy's ships x and y coordinates and its type according to passed argument values. Type 1 enemy has a movement speed of 2 and drops a score of 7. Type 2 enemy has a movement speed of 4 and drops a score of 15. Type 3 enemy has a movement speed of 6 and drops a score of 35.
      Parameters:
      x - the enemy ship's x coordinate
      y - the enemy ship's y coordinate
      type - the enemy ship's type

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public int getType()
      Specifies the enemy ship's type.
      Returns:
      the type's number value

    • getHitBox

      public java.awt.Rectangle getHitBox()
      Generates enemy ship's hit box. This handles the enemy ship's collision events.
      Returns:
      rectangle object that represents the hit box
      See Also:
      Rectangle

    • isHit

      public boolean isHit()
      Accesses the enemy ship's survival stats.
      Returns:
      the survival stats of the enemy ship

    • setHit

      public void setHit​(boolean hit)
      Sets the enemy ship's survival stats.
      Parameters:
      hit - the current survival stats of the enemy ship

    • getScoreToDrop

      public int getScoreToDrop()
      Accesses enemy's score points given to the player when the enemy ship's dies.
      Returns:
      the score value
